snippet: The president of the European Central Bank said that opting for the “easier road” of raising taxes to balance budgets would not solve Europe’s problems.
abstract: European Central Bank president Mario Draghi, ahead of crucial elections in France and Greece, says that opting for the 'easier road' of raising taxes to balance budgets will not solve Europe’s problems; bank leaves its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 1 percent.

byline.original: By RAPHAEL MINDER and JACK EWING

lead_paragraph: The president of the European Central Bank said that opting for the “easier road” of raising taxes to balance budgets would not solve Europe’s problems.

headline.seo: European Central Bank Leaves Interest Rate Unchanged
headline.main: European Central Bank Opposes Higher Taxes
headline.print_headline: Ahead of 2 Elections, European Central Bank Resists Higher Taxes
